availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Rudolph Mackwitz (St. Louis, Missouri, secretary, notary, and claims agent.)

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, secretary and notary. Native of Germany. Married to Anna Sophia Hatawa Mackwitz in St. Louis, Missouri. Secretary of the St. Louis Builders Association in St. Louis in 1860. Employed Caroline Huffman as a servant in St. Louis in 1860. Notary in St. Louis in 1863. Claims agent and attorney in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis County, St. Louis, Ward 5, p. 68.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, St. Louis County, MO, June-Sept. 1863, p. 202.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M776, Roll 4, St. Louis County, Missouri, 1864, p. 213.
Missouri, U.S., Marriage Records, 1805-2002, Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, MO, St. Louis County, p. 375
"Rudolph Mackwitz (unknown-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial 142823034, accessed October 11, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142823034.
KYR-0001-017-0260.
